message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
List<Double> list1 = ... // init here
List<Double> list2 = ... // init here
List<Double> result = new ArrayList<>();
Iterator<Double> iterator1 = list1.iterator();
Iterator<Double> iterator2 = list2.iterator();

while(iterator1.hasNext() && iterator2.hasNext()){
    result.add(iterator1.next() * iterator2.next());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use two iterators to iterate over both lists at the same time. In each iteration, you multiply the current elements of both lists and add the result to the new list. This way, you get a list of products of corresponding elements.
